codes.models module¶

class codes.models.Code(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

class that represents the table “Code” in the database.

name¶

name of the file as decided by the user

lang¶

programming language in which the code is written

code¶

the actual code

coder¶

points to the user who stores the code in database.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

LANGUAGES = (('C', 'C++'), ('P', 'Python'), ('J', 'Java'))¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

code¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

coder¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

codes.tests module¶

codes.urls module¶

codes.views module¶

codes.views.deletecode(request, file)¶

Processes Delete code file request

The method retrieves the Code object from the Code database that corresponds to the file name passed as an argument and then deletes the file. Finally the user is redirected to codes/showcodes.html

Parameters

request and a file name which has to be removed from the database. (GET) –

Returns

A HttpResponseRedirect to the codes/showcodes.html page with the updated list after deleting this file.

codes.views.practice(request)¶

To process the GET request on pressing the Practice link from the left navigation bar of the homepage.

It renders codes/practice.html containing a html form for the user to code, save and practice.

Parameters

GET request requested from the left navigation bar. (A) –

Returns

It renders codes/practice.html that has a form for user to enter code and run in three programming languages-C++, Java, Python

codes.views.runcode(request, file)¶

Compilation and execution of the code

The method is triggered when the user presses run on the showcodes.html page.It takes as argument, the file name. Hence, retrieves the code object from the Code table corresponding to the file name and the current user. It then checks the language of the file. According to the language of the code file, it runs the corresponding code. It uses subprocess module to compile and execute the code.

Parameters

POST request and file name (A) –

Returns

It renders back the codes/showcode/file but this time with compile error, if there is one or stdout of the process, if there is one.

codes.views.savecode(request)¶

Process the request from the “Save” link from the codes/practice.html

Takes in the inputs from the form. Uses a try-except block to check the validity of the form data and renders the codes/practice.html with the supporting error message, if any error in the form data is found. If everything is fine, then the form data is stored into the Code table with the coder being the current user.

Parameters

GET request from the practice page. (A) –

Returns

Returns the codes/practice.html if with an error, if the form data is wrong and with just the saved code, if the form data is succesfully stored into the database.

codes.views.showcode(request, file)¶

Processing GET request from the code file links from the codes/showcodes.html

Reminds the user if already in Premium plan and displays message if desired to use code directory structure

Parameters

  • request (GET) –

  • with the file name that wants to be retrieved (along) –

Returns

Returns a html page, ‘codes/showcode.html’, along with any message that is passed

codes.views.showcodes(request)¶

To display all the saved codes from the database corresponding to the user requesting it.

If the user is subscribed to the premium plan, then the user is reminded of it with the string stored in the variable submessage, statnding for subscription_message. The method then retrieves all the entries in the Code table that have the current user as the coder and a list of Code objects is generated.

Parameters

GET request requesting the codes written by the current user. (A) –

Returns

Renders the HTML page, codes/showcodes.html with the list of all codes that the user has stored in the database.

codes.views.subcription_status(request)¶

Check whether user is subscribed to code directory or not

Uses the present request and finds if the respective user is subscribed or not.

Parameters

request – the present request at any point

Returns

A Boolean value. Returns true if the current user sending the request is subscribed to code directory

codes.views.updatecode(request, file)¶

Processes update request to the code of an already existing code object in Code table

This is triggered when the user changes the code from the codes/showcode.html page and presses save. The updated code is obtained from the form that exists in the codes/showcode.html page. The code object corresponding to the user and the file name given as arguments. THe code is then updated and saved. Finally user is redirected to the page showing the updated code.

Parameters

request and file name of the file being modified. (GET) –

Returns

HttpResponseRedirect to the codes/showcode/file which displays the updated code.
